p: On February 2016, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the Zika virus (ZIKV) an epidemic in Brazil and a public health emergency of international concern due to its associated neurological complications in newborns [ 9]. Since 2015, ZIKV has become an increasing threat to Peru as four neighboring countries have reported endemic cases of this disease. [ 8, 10, 11]. However, until January 2016, the national health report has not identified any cases of ZIKV since its epidemiological alert was issued in October 2015 [ 12].
